nav.div: Brady Independent School District » News » Archived News » COVID-19 Response Plan March 14, 2020

a.title: For a copy of this COVID-19 plan click here.

br.a: For a copy of this plan click here.

br.br:
The information on the COVID-19 virus is changing rapidly. While there have been no cases of COVID-19 in McCulloch County, we want to be proactive in providing educational services during very unpredictable times. Based on information received at a 10:00 meeting this morning, Brady ISD will extend spring break for students through at least March 22, 2020. This extension allows our district to make plans to provide educational, food, and special education services within our district while students are not in attendance. You can expect to see these plans by March 18, 2020.
On March 16, 2020, all campus personnel should report at 8:00 am. All other district personnel should report to their usual locations at their regular start times. Any staff who traveled internationally or domestically, where they may have been exposed to COVID-19, should immediately contact their supervisor before reporting to work.
Based on the ever-changing nature of this situation, our district will continue to meet and adjust as needed. We all understand these are decisions that have huge impacts on our community on multiple fronts. We appreciate your patience as we work through unpredictable times. Please monitor our district’s website and social media for updated information. As of today, our district plans to reopen to students on March 23, 2020.
Hector Martinez ED. D.
BISD Superintendent

div.div: 1003 West 11th Street, Brady, TX 76825 | Phone 325-597-2301 | Fax 325-597-3984
